reviews.sentence: Great package. Had a great time and value with the couples package. Excellent room dinner and morning swim can not beat this facility and location for seeing Richmond. Located in the slip with access to several very nice restaurants as well as shopping. visit and have fun.

Christmas Lighting. What a treat. I attended a brief conference meeting here in early December and stayed over an extra night. I was so glad I did. The first weekend in December offers great sights to locals and tourists. The hotel is the center of the action too. Outside they light hundreds of lights and had showcases music free cocoa and cider and more. It was a wonderful visit. Check in and check out was seamless. The pool is really nice with a retractable roof. The hotel partners with a local gym so you have to another building to access it. No worries it is still inside. The restuarant serves an amazing lunch menu. it is a bit eclectic especially for the brunch but it is still delicious and worth a visit. My only dislike were the beds. I mentioned something at check out because I would be coming back in a few months for another conference. I was told during the renovation currently taking place beds were being replaced. If the bed was not too my liking I could also ask for a board to firm up the bed. I have to get something. That stay was made horrid by the bed. The shower is also a bit outdated and sprouts almost everywhere. The temp and pressure was nice but I felt as if I was cleaning the entire bathroom because the water seemed to be all over the place. Otherwise a good visit. Parking is approximately 20 night valet I believe. I walked to the hotel from the train station. About 10 minutes. It was a beautiful December day. Not too cold or breezy. Straight shot requiring two turns. There was an incline involved. I had a roller bag and my purse. There were an abundance of restaurants nearby. You can see the Capitol building from the hotel window by the elevator from the 9th floor on up. Although I am not super impressed and I will admit renovations are needed I had definitely return and recommend this hotel to others. I hope you find this review helpful.

Great Stay at the Omni. The Omni Hotel in Richmond is a great place for conferences and meetings. The ballroom exhibit space and conference rooms are very well arranged and provide adequate space. The hotel itself offers good food excellent service a quiet pool and if you are on the higher floors great views of Richmond. The rooms are quiet spacious and comfortable. I have stayed here several times and have never had a bad experience.

great business stay. Stayed here 2 nights for a conference. The hotel is very nice looking and spacious. With the exception of one waiter all the hotel staff were very helpful and professional. I had a corner room with one queen bed. The room was a nice size and the bed and linen were very comfortable. The drapes kept the sun out in the morning. Staying on the third floor I was still able to hear street noise at night. The bathroom was a good size. The pool was delightful also on the third floor. The location is great. it is a very short drive from the main street train station and the hotel has a free shuttle to take you places within a 5 mile radius. The hotel is close to the canal walk James River and lots of bars and restaurants. I had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was good though a tad pricey. There is a buffet or you can order from a large menu selection. There is a fee for wi fi unles you have a specific hotel membership. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Fabulous Hotel. Our stay at the Omni was fabulous. We loved the outdoor deck next to the indoor pool area and enjoyed a relaxing afternoon in the sun. The overall experience was excellent and I would highly recomend staying here.
Great bargain great location. Great time sorry the pool closed for a couple days during our stay. Centrally located.
I had a great time rooms where clean. hotel was pretty especially the pool with all the amenities. Check in was professional and friendly.

Surprisingly Good. We visited at the end of August and got this hotel for a very reasonable rate. Given how much we paid our expectations were not high. In fact we impressed. In advance of our stay we liked the helpful email from the concierge On arrival the very reasonably priced valet parking was a real bonus. With the hotel being very central and a great free shuttle service we did not need the car again. What really made our stay was the friendliness of the staff. Highly professional and always helpful they really stood out from the staff in other chain hotels we have stayed in. We also liked the pool which was a great place to relax. For the money the rooms were excellent. Sadly no sign of a commitment to recycling. If you can get this hotel at a reasonable rate you should book it.

Disappointing stay with lackluster customer service. I had high hopes for this luxury hotel stay but it did not meet expectations. The walls are so thin that it sounded like our neighbor was actually in our room not pleasant to hear every phone conversation can opening burp. Satellite TV service was sketchy during a rain storm. Mildew in the bathroom. Valet service disorganized. We asked to speak with a sales manager about a wedding room block when we checked in but were never contacted which is not surprising since the check in clerk barely had time for us too busy gossiping with a coworker. On the pros the pool area was nice and the beds were comfortable. Overall not what I had expect from a 4 star hotel.

Great location. Modern Hotel in a Great Location. Right on the main drag with most good restaurants. Hotels are typical modern size and amenities so no complaints. Restaurant and pool on premises. Had a high floor but on wrong side so had view of the highways.

Nice Stay. Good stay big rooms and nice beds. The pool was closed which was big bummer for my kids. O would have liked that OMNI would have taken control and catered to our children. The hotel is very close to great restaurant and.

Pleasant Stay. My family and I only stayed here for one night. We booked the room last night on Priceline not knowing what to expect. When we walked through the doors we were in disbelief that we had booked a room here. The interior design was BEAUTIFUL. We got to the rooms which were pretty average but great for the one night stay we were there. It was clean and spacious. The only amenity that we utilized was the pool. The layout was very nice was a little chilly though. Overall great stay.

Weekend visit. My friends and I stayed here for a weekend trip to the Richmond area. The hotel itself is beautiful clean and well maintained. Housekeeping was spot on with their service and even with additional calls later into the night. We did not use the pool facilities but did check them out and they also looked well maintained. The only downside of the hotel was that due to several large group bookings we were not able to get adjoining rooms. However the front desk was awesome with finding us two rooms that were next door to each otherA couple of tips valet parking can be very pricey. There is a garage across the street that is a much cheaper option for overnight parking. Also if you sign up for the Omni rewards program they immediately give you free wi fi as a perk. Plus you can start racking up points towards other goodies.

Decent hotel with good location facilities. Looked more like 5 star hotel rather than 4Decent location very clean and good ambience. Staff were generally good. Welcome with an apple unusual but healthy. The swimming pool was out of order. The bed was extremely comfortable very high. Overall a good experience.

Housekeeping was a Success. I have been an out of town regular at this hotel for the past 3 years but have stayed away for the past 5 months due to an inoperable pool. However I returned to my favorite hotel in Richmond and was quite taken back by the friendliness warmth and TLC by the staff. We did have a slight hiccup with my refrigerator which was requested four days in advance and when I arrived in my preferred room it was nowhere to be found. However Jesica Anunziata made sure to get it to my room and also kept me hydrated throughout the trip and ended up with more water than I needed for my swimming and walking activities during the weekend. She also went out of her away and surprised me with a swimming towel waiting in my room so it was a very lovely gesture and I appreciate the warmth and thought that made me feel very special at the hotel. I also was tickled pink by Tobie Mayer Director of Rooms who personally made sure that my room would be taken care of and housekeeping did not disappoint so she was a lady of her word and quite touched that she would take time out of her busy schedule to accommodate my needs. It was truly an organization that cares about its guests and I was impressed also by their newer employee Ryan who also went out of his way to make sure my breakfast was good on Saturday and also has a warmth and genuine personality to make me feel special as a returning guest. Therefore I will returning to the Omni on my next trip in August as a gesture for the wonderful treatment and hospitality that they showed and really make me feel like family which is unusual in this cold corporate climate that we experience as travelers.

Elegant comfortable all encompassing hotel. This hotel is lovely. The staff were always acomodating and kind. The foyer is beautiful marble fresh flower arrangements and the fireplace area with leather wingback chairs a great place to wait for friends or relax outside the room. The pool area was nice clean lots of choices to sit but it is enclosed under a glass type ceiling. I prefer open air but it did not stop me from swimming and enjoying the water. There is a large sun deck. Again the area was clean and well kept. I loved the conveniences of the area outside the hotel bank and historic areas. There are MANY restaurant choices outside the hotel and a very good Italian restaurant in house very nice hostess and waitstaf EXCELLENT GELATO TRIO. For dessert. We ordered it 3 timesthe service was a little slow although we found that to be true all over the city. All the food we had was very good to excellent. The shuttle service that is offered by this hotel was fabulous and it enabled me to see many wonderful places within a few mile radius. It was especially helpful because it was such hot weather. Our room was a tiny bit dusty and the housekeeping service was not always consistent meaning sometimes new glasses were not left or no tea replaced etc. but mainly little things like that. The beds were really comfortable and there was a nice view of the capital building. One early evening as we were arriving back at the hotel from an outing a staff member was standing by the main lobby with a tray full of complimentary glasses of champagne and strawberries for the guests. I have never seen that before and was really impressed. This hotel is in a great location to see many interesting andor historic places in Richmond. I had such a great experience at this hotel in Richmond and would definitely recommend it to anyone who asked. I will absolutely stay there again if I am ever visiting the area.

Great Service though pricey for what you get. This review is 35 stars. As mentioned in other reviews the service is outstanding. There is a superior help the customer attitude from everyone from the bell hops to the maids. You also can not beat the location. The Club Lounge level entitles you to a room with snacks beer and wine but no other amenities. We overall had a good experience but our total tab for 2 nights was 614 booking a month in advance which seems a poor value. Areas that we were not happy with included only 2 working elevators. Our card key to get us to the 19th floor did not work properly our toilet clogged up the windows were very dirty the fan in the AC unit was very noisy we never did figure out where the pool was the phone did not work for valet concierge etc you had to hit 0 for the operator our original room on the 18th floor faced a construction site We had to request a river view room.

Great location very swank. We stayed at the Omni this past weekend the first time to this particular Richmond hotel. Check in was smooth valet service polite and accommodating in the extreme and the room was clean and very nice. My wife and daughter took advantage of the pool also very nice and we all took advantage of the Starbucks and Candy Shop located off the lobby. The only issues I had was the 25 a night parking which I think is pretty high and the really strong smell of disinfectant in the hallway of our floor. I thought it might have something to do with the pool being on our floor but man was it overpowering. Not sure what the deal is with parking. We have stayed at the Crowne which is just a couple of blocks away and parking is free. The only reasons I could not give the 5th star.

Good hotel. The Richmond Omni is a step above most good hotels. It is more of a luxury hotel but could also use some updating. The beds are comfortable the service is good and the facilities are also pretty good. Using the YMCA seems a little complicated since it is separate from the hotel but the process was not explained very well. There is a nice indoor pool on the 3rd floor that was not being used while I was there. Next time I will bring a suit.
No outdoor pool no place to get a pop.

Solid hotel but the customer service is top notch. Pro tip shuttle bus will pick up drop off anywhere within 5 miles. The room was clean. The bed was nice. The pool was nice but no hot tub and the gym was off site but nearby. The staff was EXCELLENT. They were on top of everything. Any issue was immediately addressed. Also the shuttle bus was a nice perk.
Good. It was very clean and staff was very welcoming. The pool was below par also they had rented it to a birthday party which made it very crowded almost to a level we could n’t use it.

I would not recommend this hotel. They put us in a room by the elevator and one made an awful screeching noise everytime it ran all night long. When I said something to the front desk the response was yeah we need to get that fixed. If you knew why not fix it or not put guests in those rooms. The restaurant service was awful over 45 minutes to get a beer and waiter reached over everyone constantly and the food was mediocre at best. The pool while heated includes a retract roof windows that were open when it was 30 degrees outside. The rooms are nice and clean but you can get a better overall experience elsewhere in Richmond.

Pleasant staff was super nice. Room was spacious clean and easy to get to. I thought I had requested a high room but we got 3rd floor looking out to the pool deck. The bathroom switch was on the outside of the bathroom weird. The towel rack on the door was just high enough that I got gourd in the arm.
